hints.content:
$872 + {\goldE{?}} = 981$

![A number line with 2 points labeled. An arrow from point 872 to point 981 is labeled, plus question mark.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/b53d60cd4c379946e4bdcbcc16882fe01b8d6beb)

Let's start by adding hundreds to ${872}$ until we get as close to  ${981}$ as possible without going over ${981}$.

$\begin{align}
{872} +\purpleD{100}=972
\end{align}$

If we add $\purpleD{1 \text{ hundred}}$, or $\purpleD{1 00}$, we reach $972$. We cannot add any more hundreds without going over ${981}$.

![The same number line, with an arrow from point 872 to a new point 972 labeled, "plus 100"](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/785b52c41739272b1db31bfb5691d477099f273c)

Next, let's add tens to $972$ until we get as close to  ${981}$ as possible without going over ${981}$.

We cannot add any tens without going over ${981}$.

Finally, how many ones should we add to  $972$ to get to  ${981}?$

$\begin{align}
972+\greenD{8} &=980\\\\
980+\greenD{1} &=981
\end{align}$

We add $\greenD{9\text{ ones}}$.

![The same number line, with an arrow from point 972 to point 981 labeled, "plus 9"](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/7178d08963faf6124f74b0825c32aa1644bc925e)

We added $\purpleD{1 \text{ hundred}}$ and $\greenD{9\text{ ones}}$ to ${872}$ to get to ${981}$.

$\purpleD{1 00}+\greenD{9}=\goldE{109}$

![The number line with all of the arrows shown. The original arrow from point 872 to point 981 is labeled, "plus 109." The arrows spans the arrows labeled "plus 100" and "plus 9."](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/7a22567bef24e55548e06f0f7dc1a2eaff034864)
